options.systemMessage:
=System Prompt (Formatted for Use):

You are a career assistant helping users evaluate job postings against their profile. The user will provide:

Their About Me description.

Their Skills list.

A job posting text.

Your task is to analyze the job posting and respond strictly in JSON array format with the following structure:
  {
    "job_title": "Title of the job",
    "match": "Yes or No",
    "reason": "A short explanation why this job is a strong match for me"
}
Instructions for completion:

Read the user's About Me and Skills carefully.

Compare them to the job posting text.

Determine if the user is a strong match for the role.

Fill in all JSON fields with accurate or best-estimate information.

Respond only in valid JSON array format, no extra text or explanations.

If any information is not available in the posting, use "Not specified".

=You are an assistant that summarizes LinkedIn job search data from JSON input. Your responsibilities: 1. Accept JSON data containing any number of job postings. Each posting may have keys like: job_title, reason, url, job_location, job_seniority_level, job_posted_time, job_num_applicants, match, job_function, job_employment_type, company_url, or others. 2. Dynamically handle any keys: include them in the summary table if present, skip them if missing. 3. Present a **clean, professional HTML summary** of new jobs. 4. Include at least these details if available: Job Title (bold), Location, Seniority Level, Posted Time, Number of Applicants, Match Status, Employment Type, Company URL (clickable). 5. Calculate "days since posted" from `job_posted_time` if possible, and highlight matches if `match` is "Yes". 6. Structure HTML with a table for easy reading, with headers and alternating row colors. 7. Include a total count of jobs and today's date at the top. 8. Only return **direct HTML**, no extra text or explanations. 9. Ensure the HTML works for any number of jobs and variable JSON keys. Example HTML structure:

LinkedIn Job Search Daily Summary

Total New Jobs: X

Start From: TODAY'S DATE

......
Today is {{ $now.format('cccc') }} the {{ $now.format('yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm') }}.

parameters.content:
# üõ†Ô∏è Setup Guide  

**Author: [Sohail Jafri](https://link.thesohailjafri.me/web_ai) | [Youtube](https://link.thesohailjafri.me/yt_ai) | [Instagram](https://link.thesohailjafri.me/ig_ai) | [Join Skool](https://link.thesohailjafri.me/join-skool)**

Follow the steps below to get your LinkedIn Job Scraper running:

### ‚úÖ Step 1: Copy the Google Sheet template  
Make a copy of the sheet and connect it to the **[Append row in sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1awPFjM8r-fimvwiYznWLMF1KxRx2MRDrqs-fYWnaOs4/copy)** node.  
Template: 

### ‚úÖ Step 2: Add [Apify Data](https://console.apify.com/) credentials  
Add your Apify Data token to the Apify nodes.  

### ‚úÖ Step 3: Connect your AI models  
Add your OpenRouter (or preferred LLM) API key to both LM nodes used for screening and email composition.  
- [OpenRouter](https://openrouter.ai/)
- [OpenAI](https://platform.openai.com/)

### ‚úÖ Step 4: Add [Resend](https://resend.com/) API key  
Configure the Resend bearer token in the **Send Mail** node to enable daily emails.  


### ‚úÖ Step 5: Populate Edit Fields  
Fill these values in the **Edit Fields** node:  
- **ABOUT_ME** ‚Äî short resume summary  
- **MY_SKILL** ‚Äî comma-separated skill list  
- **JOB_INPUT** ‚Äî array of search queries (location, keyword, time_range, job_type, experience_level, remote)

### ‚úÖ Step 6: Test the flow  
Run the workflow manually with a small JOB_INPUT to confirm end-to-end success.

### üí° Quick config tips
- **Poll interval** = 2 minutes (adjust in **Wait - Polling Apify Data** if needed).  
- Ensure the Google Sheet columns match the node schema.  
- Verify the email **to** address in **Send Mail** before enabling production.

### ‚úÖ Final step: Enable workflow  
Switch the workflow to active after confirming credentials and a successful test run.

values.content:
=You're an intelligent bot rating how closely a job listing is to a candidates skill set, on a score of 10. Please add up all the points and create a total out of 10.
a) 4 points for my resume is an amazing fit for the job, 2 point for mostly matching
b) 3 point if the job is paying over $17/hr, $2,000/month or $30,000/year
c) 1 point for it being a remote position (should equal true)
e) 1 point if the company offers benefits (any benefits)
f) 1 point if it's full time (not contract or part-time)

For example:
If the job fits mostly, and pays over $25/hr, and is remote, but has no benefits and is not full-time, the total points would be: 6
###
If the job fits perfectly, but is under $30,000/year, isn't a remote position, has a few benefits, and isn't full-time, the total points would be: 5

json.descriptionHtml:
HIRING: Email Marketing Manager (Klaviyo-Focused)

NOTE: If you do not have experience with Klaviyo, please do not apply.

We are Kensington Media House, a performance-driven team that has generated over $300M in revenue for 7-9 figure eCommerce brands through strategic email and SMS marketing.

Due to our rapid growth, we're expanding our team of elite marketers who work with some of the world's most successful direct-to-consumer brands.


Why This Opportunity is Different

We've built something special here. While most agencies treat employees like replaceable cogs in a machine, we actually give a damn about you as a human being. Here's what makes us different:

  • Real freedom to do your best work
  • Flexible hours that actually fit your life
  • Remote work from anywhere in your timezone
  • Training from some of the best email marketers in the industry
  • Campaigns that generate millions in revenue for major brands


Our clients span the US, UK, EU, Middle East and Asia. You'll be working on strategies that move the needle for brands most marketers only dream about.


What We're Looking For

We need someone who gets excited about strategy, not just tactics. The ideal candidate has:

  • Hands-on experience with Klaviyo or similar email platforms
  • eCommerce background (preferred but not required)
  • Detail-oriented approach to complex processes
  • Creative thinking for developing winning strategies
  • Team collaboration skills and genuine interest in others' success


Here's the thing: we care more about your drive and personality than your resume. Skills can be taught to the right person.


The Role Breakdown

Core Responsibilities:

  • Managing Klaviyo accounts for 7 and 8-figure brands
  • Developing comprehensive email strategies from concept to execution
  • Writing high-converting email copy across all campaign types
  • Building sophisticated automated email sequences
  • Collaborating with creative team on email design strategy


Client Interaction:

  • Direct communication with brand owners and marketing teams
  • Monthly strategy calls and performance reporting
  • Advising on offer strategy and conversion optimization
  • Helping clients build healthier, more profitable eCommerce businesses

Note: Fluent English is essential as this is a client-facing role


Our Values Actually Matter

We're not just putting buzzwords on a website:

  • Overdelivering - We go beyond what's asked because that's how you build something great
  • Growth mindset - We support development in career, health, relationships and life
  • Profit focus - Our clients' success drives everything we do
  • Genuine happiness - If you're miserable here, we're doing something wrong


Requirements

Must Have:

  • Location in Western Europe (GMT to GMT+2 timezone)
  • Fluent English (written and spoken)
  • Previous copywriting and email marketing experience
  • Team player mentality
  • Hunger to work with premium brands

Nice to Have:

  • Klaviyo certification or deep platform knowledge
  • eCommerce industry experience
  • Understanding of lifecycle marketing principles


Why Join Kensington Media House

Professional Growth:

  • Work with world-class team of high-performing marketers
  • Join one of Europe's fastest-growing eCommerce agencies
  • Real opportunities for leadership roles within 6-12 months
  • Elite training and ongoing education

Lifestyle Benefits:

  • True work-from-anywhere flexibility
  • Hours that work around your life, not the other way around
  • Team that actually cares about you as a person
  • Environment where your ideas and growth matter


Ready to Apply?

Fill out our screening form here: https://tally.so/r/2EE0xM

Take your time with this application. The more thoughtful detail you provide, the better we can understand who you are before moving to the next stage.


Critical Note: If you use AI to fill out the application, we'll immediately discard it. We want to hear from you, not ChatGPT. Your authentic voice is what we're looking for.

json.title: Digital Marketing Graduate
json.description: About This PositionJoin us as a Digital Marketing Graduate and get the opportunity to work alongside professionals from diverse backgrounds to achieve common goals and drive organisational success. This is how you can dare to make an impact:What You¬¥ll DoJoin Henkel‚Äôs Consumer Brands team as a Digital Marketing Graduate and work with iconic brands such as Pritt, Sellotape, Loctite, UniBond Sealants, and UniBond No more Nails. Develop a deep understanding of the market through analysis of market data and competitor activity. Work with the brand and eCommerce/shopper team to create local digital assets across brands. Review content on websites and social media platforms, to develop strategies for better performance of assets. Working with the wider team to develop and execute ideas for websites and social media platforms (Meta, TikTok and YouTube)Regularly track, review, and optimise performance of social content and provide actionable insights to help shape the social strategy. Track and analyse competitor digital activities. Ensure the brands are at the forefront of digital opportunities (social media, e-commerce, brand websites). Identify emerging digital trends that can lead to commercial opportunities. This one-year programme is designed to develop knowledge, skills and expertise across a wide range of Marketing skills ‚Äì brand & portfolio management; digital marketing, social media & community management; stakeholder management; commercial awareness.  What makes you a good fitYou should graduate (before September 2026 and no more than two years prior) with a Bachelor, Masters (or equivalent) degree in Business, Marketing, or any related field. Previous experience in a multinational FMCG company is an advantage. Positivity and a high energy level. An enthusiastic team player who is digitally driven. Passion for the adhesives for consumer and craftsman industry; and for DIY and stationery brands. Willingness to challenge the status quo. Good judgement and creative thinking with a positive sense of initiative. Strong analytical skills. Good attention to detail. Computer literate and confident with the MS Office suite and other computer systems.  Some perks of joining Henkel Flexible work scheme with flexible hours, hybrid work model, and work from anywhere policy for up to 30 days per yearDiverse national and international growth opportunitiesGlobal wellbeing standards with health and preventive care programsGender-neutral parental leave for a minimum of 8 weeksEmployee Share Plan with voluntary investment and Henkel matching sharesPerformance bonus / incentivesCompetitive Pension & Life Assurance - Company contributes up to 10% of basic salaryAnnual Leave: 27 days plus 8 Bank HolidaysCelebration vouchersAt Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, disabilities, and generations.
json.descriptionHtml:
About This Position

Join us as a Digital Marketing Graduate and get the opportunity to work alongside professionals from diverse backgrounds to achieve common goals and drive organisational success. This is how you can dare to make an impact:

What You¬¥ll Do

  • Join Henkel‚Äôs Consumer Brands team as a Digital Marketing Graduate and work with iconic brands such as Pritt, Sellotape, Loctite, UniBond Sealants, and UniBond No more Nails.
  • Develop a deep understanding of the market through analysis of market data and competitor activity.
  • Work with the brand and eCommerce/shopper team to create local digital assets across brands.
  • Review content on websites and social media platforms, to develop strategies for better performance of assets.
  • Working with the wider team to develop and execute ideas for websites and social media platforms (Meta, TikTok and YouTube)
  • Regularly track, review, and optimise performance of social content and provide actionable insights to help shape the social strategy.
  • Track and analyse competitor digital activities.
  • Ensure the brands are at the forefront of digital opportunities (social media, e-commerce, brand websites).
  • Identify emerging digital trends that can lead to commercial opportunities.
  • This one-year programme is designed to develop knowledge, skills and expertise across a wide range of Marketing skills ‚Äì brand & portfolio management; digital marketing, social media & community management; stakeholder management; commercial awareness.

What makes you a good fit

  • You should graduate (before September 2026 and no more than two years prior) with a Bachelor, Masters (or equivalent) degree in Business, Marketing, or any related field.
  • Previous experience in a multinational FMCG company is an advantage.
  • Positivity and a high energy level.
  • An enthusiastic team player who is digitally driven.
  • Passion for the adhesives for consumer and craftsman industry; and for DIY and stationery brands.
  • Willingness to challenge the status quo.
  • Good judgement and creative thinking with a positive sense of initiative.
  • Strong analytical skills.
  • Good attention to detail.
  • Computer literate and confident with the MS Office suite and other computer systems.

Some perks of joining Henkel

  • Flexible work scheme with flexible hours, hybrid work model, and work from anywhere policy for up to 30 days per year
  • Diverse national and international growth opportunities
  • Global wellbeing standards with health and preventive care programs
  • Gender-neutral parental leave for a minimum of 8 weeks
  • Employee Share Plan with voluntary investment and Henkel matching shares
  • Performance bonus / incentives
  • Competitive Pension & Life Assurance - Company contributes up to 10% of basic salary
  • Annual Leave: 27 days plus 8 Bank Holidays
  • Celebration vouchers

At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, disabilities, and generations.

json.title: Affiliate Marketing Coordinator
json.description: Job DescriptionAs the Affiliate Marketing Coordinator, you will support the Affiliate Marketing Team in driving incremental growth for COS online and in-store. Your focus will be on the day-to-day management and execution of the affiliate channel, ensuring delivery of set KPIs and goals while collaborating with the wider Marketing & Communications team to achieve impactful, data-driven campaigns. This role is key to maintaining smooth operations and ensuring all initiatives align with our brand values and contribute to a seamless digital experience.What you will do:Support the execution of the affiliate marketing program in alignment with the regional marketing calendar and financial plan, focusing on traffic, conversion, and revenue growth. Assist in managing the affiliate publisher portfolio, ensuring timely delivery of campaign activations and compliance with brand guidelines. Coordinate creative asset requests with content and artworking teams, maintaining workflow and deadlines. Prepare and maintain accurate weekly, monthly, and ad hoc performance reports, analyzing KPIs such as traffic, orders, revenue, spend, ROAS, and CVR. Support budget checks and pacing to ensure cost efficiency against channel targets. Manage relationships with affiliate publishers and assist with exposure package negotiations based on performance insights. Stay informed on industry trends, competitor activity, and marketing calendar updates to deliver innovative campaign activations. Ensure workflow documents and reporting processes are maintained to high standards with attention to detail. Collaborate closely with the Affiliate Marketing Specialist and wider Marketing & Communications team to achieve set KPIs and goals. QualificationsAlignment to our company values is the most important characteristic we look for in all new joiners. Our values are the behaviours that we appreciate above and beyond anything else. We are open-minded and curious, we dare to be different, we believe in constant improvement and we empower and trust you to take ownership. Our values are part of who we are, what we stand for and how we act.What you need to succeed Previous experience in affiliate marketing or digital marketing, ideally within fashion or retail. Strong analytical skills with proficiency in tools such as Google Analytics and Microsoft Excel. Detail-oriented and highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines. Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with internal teams and external partners. Proactive and self-driven, with a willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment. Familiarity with affiliate platforms (e.g., Rakuten) and basic understanding of marketing performance metrics is a plus. Additional InformationThis is a full time permanent contracted of 39 hours a week based at our Regional Office in London.Benefits We offer all our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a 25% staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program ‚Äì HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.In addition to this London based colleagues also receive  25 days holidayAnnual health checksPension schemeDiscounts on various activities and financial/lifestyle products via our benefits hubCycle to work schemeDiscounted gym membershipEmployee assistance via retail trust  Private health & dental careInclusion & DiversityAt COS we‚Äôre determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process. Company DescriptionAbout COS: COS offers a wardrobe of ready-to-wear and accessories rooted in exceptional quality and lasting design. The creative soul of the brand is fuelled by a deep connection to modern culture, dynamic global cities and compelling fashion movements. With an emphasis on expert craftsmanship, innovation and materiality, collections are created with a mindful approach, seamlessly blending contemporary and timeless. Learn more about COS here.In this role you will be able to take advantage of a hybrid working arrangement. You will have the flexibility to work both remotely and, from the office. While remote working is an integral part of our part of our offer, approx. 3 days per week office presence will be required to foster strong collaborations and team work. Ready to apply? Click on the I‚ÄôM INTERESTED link where you can upload your CV securely. Once we have received your application, we will keep you updated regularly about the status of your application, so please look out for our emails. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, but no later than 29th November.We are looking forward to hearing from you!
json.descriptionHtml:
Job Description

As the Affiliate Marketing Coordinator, you will support the Affiliate Marketing Team in driving incremental growth for COS online and in-store. Your focus will be on the day-to-day management and execution of the affiliate channel, ensuring delivery of set KPIs and goals while collaborating with the wider Marketing & Communications team to achieve impactful, data-driven campaigns. This role is key to maintaining smooth operations and ensuring all initiatives align with our brand values and contribute to a seamless digital experience.

What you will do:

  • Support the execution of the affiliate marketing program in alignment with the regional marketing calendar and financial plan, focusing on traffic, conversion, and revenue growth.
  • Assist in managing the affiliate publisher portfolio, ensuring timely delivery of campaign activations and compliance with brand guidelines.
  • Coordinate creative asset requests with content and artworking teams, maintaining workflow and deadlines.
  • Prepare and maintain accurate weekly, monthly, and ad hoc performance reports, analyzing KPIs such as traffic, orders, revenue, spend, ROAS, and CVR.
  • Support budget checks and pacing to ensure cost efficiency against channel targets.
  • Manage relationships with affiliate publishers and assist with exposure package negotiations based on performance insights.
  • Stay informed on industry trends, competitor activity, and marketing calendar updates to deliver innovative campaign activations.
  • Ensure workflow documents and reporting processes are maintained to high standards with attention to detail.
  • Collaborate closely with the Affiliate Marketing Specialist and wider Marketing & Communications team to achieve set KPIs and goals.

Qualifications

Alignment to our company values is the most important characteristic we look for in all new joiners. Our values are the behaviours that we appreciate above and beyond anything else. We are open-minded and curious, we dare to be different, we believe in constant improvement and we empower and trust you to take ownership. Our values are part of who we are, what we stand for and how we act.

What you need to succeed

  • Previous experience in affiliate marketing or digital marketing, ideally within fashion or retail.
  • Strong analytical skills with proficiency in tools such as Google Analytics and Microsoft Excel.
  • Detail-oriented and highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with internal teams and external partners.
  • Proactive and self-driven, with a willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.
  • Familiarity with affiliate platforms (e.g., Rakuten) and basic understanding of marketing performance metrics is a plus.

Additional Information

This is a full time permanent contracted of 39 hours a week based at our Regional Office in London.

Benefits

We offer all our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a 25% staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program ‚Äì HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.

In addition to this London based colleagues also receive

  • 25 days holiday
  • Annual health checks
  • Pension scheme
  • Discounts on various activities and financial/lifestyle products via our benefits hub
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Discounted gym membership
  • Employee assistance via retail trust
  • Private health & dental care

Inclusion & Diversity

At COS we‚Äôre determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.

Company Description

About COS: COS offers a wardrobe of ready-to-wear and accessories rooted in exceptional quality and lasting design. The creative soul of the brand is fuelled by a deep connection to modern culture, dynamic global cities and compelling fashion movements. With an emphasis on expert craftsmanship, innovation and materiality, collections are created with a mindful approach, seamlessly blending contemporary and timeless. Learn more about COS here.

In this role you will be able to take advantage of a hybrid working arrangement. You will have the flexibility to work both remotely and, from the office. While remote working is an integral part of our part of our offer, approx. 3 days per week office presence will be required to foster strong collaborations and team work.



Ready to apply? Click on the I‚ÄôM INTERESTED link where you can upload your CV securely. Once we have received your application, we will keep you updated regularly about the status of your application, so please look out for our emails. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, but no later than 29th November.

We are looking forward to hearing from you!

IMG is a subsidiary of TKO Group Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: TKO), a premium sports and entertainment company.What You‚Äôll Do:The Marketing Coordinator will play a crucial role within our marketing team, providing essential support in the planning, coordination, and execution of IMG campaigns and wider brand projects. This position will work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to help organise campaign assets, manage timelines, track deliverables, and ensure that all marketing initiatives are executed smoothly and effectively. The Marketing Coordinator will also assist with campaign reporting, vendor communication, and day-to-day administrative tasks that contribute to the overall success of our brand marketing efforts.Applications will close Sunday 21st December at 11.59pm UK TimeKey Responsibilities and Accountabilities:Assist in the development, coordination and rollout of marketing projects including campaigns across channels such as digital, social, email, and traditional media. Working with the central digital marketing team, champion digital activations for campaigns, including website updates, social media coordination and execution, and reporting. Coordinate timelines, deliverables, and approvals with cross-functional teams (creative, sales, external agencies etc). Manage day-to-day tasks to ensure campaigns launch on time and stay on schedule. Support the creation of creative briefs, content calendars, and promotional plans. Work with designers, writers, and external agencies to source, organise, and deliver assets. Ensure all creative materials meet brand standards and campaign requirements. Track revisions, feedback, and approvals throughout the creative process. Work with the digital team to track campaign performance metrics and prepare reports to share insights and recommendations with the wider team. Champion the IMG Brand and support on brand projects including co-ordination of asset delivery and rollout. Sourcing and coordination of key assets and footage for ongoing projects. Monitor and track budgets and vendor invoices. Skills and Experience:Project coordination: Ability to manage timelines, track deliverables, and keep campaigns on schedule. Organisation & attention to detail: Skilled at juggling multiple tasks, maintaining accurate records, and ensuring high-quality output. Communication skills: Strong written and verbal communication for liaising with internal teams, vendors, and partners. Creative mindset: Comfortable contributing ideas and reviewing creative assets. Digital marketing knowledge: Understanding of social media, email marketing and digital best practices. Problem-solving: Ability to troubleshoot issues and adapt quickly in a fast-moving environment. Working ConditionsThe work location is Chiswick Park, London.This is a permanent contract.You'll usually work normal office hours, however, you may work longer hours, including evening and weekend work, when working to a campaign or creative deadline.
json.descriptionHtml:
Who We Are:

IMG is a leading global sports marketing agency, specializing in media rights management and sales, multi-channel content production and distribution, brand partnerships, strategic consulting, digital services, and events management. It powers growth of revenues, fanbases and IP for more than 200 federations, associations, events, and teams, including the National Football League, English Premier League, International Olympic Committee, National Hockey League, Major League Soccer, ATP and WTA Tours, the AELTC (Wimbledon), Euroleague Basketball, CONMEBOL, DP World Tour, and The R&A, as well as UFC, WWE, and PBR. IMG is a subsidiary of TKO Group Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: TKO), a premium sports and entertainment company.

What You‚Äôll Do:

The Marketing Coordinator will play a crucial role within our marketing team, providing essential support in the planning, coordination, and execution of IMG campaigns and wider brand projects. This position will work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to help organise campaign assets, manage timelines, track deliverables, and ensure that all marketing initiatives are executed smoothly and effectively. The Marketing Coordinator will also assist with campaign reporting, vendor communication, and day-to-day administrative tasks that contribute to the overall success of our brand marketing efforts.

Applications will close Sunday 21st December at 11.59pm UK Time

Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:

  • Assist in the development, coordination and rollout of marketing projects including campaigns across channels such as digital, social, email, and traditional media.
  • Working with the central digital marketing team, champion digital activations for campaigns, including website updates, social media coordination and execution, and reporting.
  • Coordinate timelines, deliverables, and approvals with cross-functional teams (creative, sales, external agencies etc).
  • Manage day-to-day tasks to ensure campaigns launch on time and stay on schedule.
  • Support the creation of creative briefs, content calendars, and promotional plans.
  • Work with designers, writers, and external agencies to source, organise, and deliver assets.
  • Ensure all creative materials meet brand standards and campaign requirements.
  • Track revisions, feedback, and approvals throughout the creative process.
  • Work with the digital team to track campaign performance metrics and prepare reports to share insights and recommendations with the wider team.
  • Champion the IMG Brand and support on brand projects including co-ordination of asset delivery and rollout.
  • Sourcing and coordination of key assets and footage for ongoing projects.
  • Monitor and track budgets and vendor invoices.

Skills and Experience:

  • Project coordination: Ability to manage timelines, track deliverables, and keep campaigns on schedule.
  • Organisation & attention to detail: Skilled at juggling multiple tasks, maintaining accurate records, and ensuring high-quality output.
  • Communication skills: Strong written and verbal communication for liaising with internal teams, vendors, and partners.
  • Creative mindset: Comfortable contributing ideas and reviewing creative assets.
  • Digital marketing knowledge: Understanding of social media, email marketing and digital best practices.
  • Problem-solving: Ability to troubleshoot issues and adapt quickly in a fast-moving environment.

Working Conditions

  • The work location is Chiswick Park, London.
  • This is a permanent contract.
  • You'll usually work normal office hours, however, you may work longer hours, including evening and weekend work, when working to a campaign or creative deadline.

json.descriptionHtml:
Job Requirements

Position Summary

The Marketing Coordinator supports the Marketing Manager across all stages of the Marketing lifecycle. From new product launches to consumer marketing campaigns, by managing key marketing milestones, contributing to go-to-market toolkits, coordinating cross-functional teams, and ensuring the timely delivery of products and campaigns. This role works in close collaboration with both global and regional teams. Focused on executional excellence, market insights, and consumer engagement, this role enables effective product launch, go-to-market execution and contributes to brand growth through detailed planning and strong collaboration.

Header

Key Responsibilities

Collaboration:

  • Demonstrate ownership by executing projects with excellence and communicating key results and insights.
  • Build effective cross-functional and external collaborative relationships to deliver business objectives.
  • Proactively seek opportunities for learning, development, and contribution beyond core responsibilities

New Product Lanch Management

  • Christmas and Gifting campaigns.
  • Responsible for programme key milestones to ensure timely execution:
  • Responsible for copy sheets and Teamcentre system inputs
  • Responsible for building financial scenarios and contributing to forecasting alignment
  • Support project management for programmes in product planning database (Runway) to facilitate cross-functional workflows
  • Oversee collateral production and manage external vendors in partnership with Indirect Procurement
  • Support Regions‚Äô marketing plans by preparing materials to facilitate local execution (Bulletins, Forecasting
  • Documents, Forecast Alignment docs)
  • Assist with project tracking and administrative tasks to ensure efficient project management
  • Conduct market and competitor analysis to identify trends and opportunities in the market
  • Pull sales data for performance tracking and input into programme planning
  • Support regions with bulletin queries, retailer master decks and coordinate delivery of lab samples, comps

Campaign Planning and GMT

  • Assist in strategically planning 360¬∞ marketing campaigns for product launches and brand activations
  • Coordinate with internal teams (Creative, Product Development, Channel Marketing) to ensure timely delivery ofcampaign assets aligned across consumer touchpoints
  • Support the development of Go-To-Market guidelines to ensure consistency and scalability in local market execution
  • Work with Regional leads and internal teams to monitor campaign KPIs and prepare performance reports to assess ROI and inform future strategies
  • Assist with post-campaign analysis to extract insights & learnings to inform future programmes and drive continuous improvement in marketing effectiveness
  • Conduct competitive research on product assortments, launch strategies and in-market activations to identify best practices

Qualifications

  • Have strong organisation skills with an ability to prioritise and manage multiple projects at one time to a high level of detail
  • Be highly numerate and analytical with an ability to cross reference a variety of sources to reach firm conclusions
  • Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills with ability to interface and build relationships with many departments across the organisation
  • Demonstrate both a creative and commercial mind-set and use this approach in making recommendations
  • Be resilient, adaptable and reliable, committed and with a will to go above and beyond
  • Be self-motivated with energy and enthusiasm to drive results
  • Be naturally curious with a strong interest in the consumer, cultural diversity, and industry trends, enthusiasm and passio

json.descriptionHtml:
Who We Are

We are an organisation that exists to drive progress. That's the ‚Äúred thread‚Äù that connects everyone at The Economist Group (TEG). Our businesses share a devotion to innovation, independence and rigour in their fields of expertise. We empower people to understand and tackle the critical challenges and changes facing the world. Our analytical rigour, global expertise and evidence-based insights enable individuals and organisations to make sense of these shifts and chart a course through them.

We deliver analysis and insights in many formats to subscribers and clients in 170 countries through our four businesses, The Economist, Economist Impact, Economist Intelligence and Economist Education, which uphold our global reputation for excellence and integrity.

We are looking for a motivated, detail-oriented and data-driven Email Marketing Executive to join our Growth Marketing Team. The successful candidate will build, launch, and optimise performance-driven email marketing campaigns ensuring continuous improvement in driving consumer engagement and subscriptions for The Economist.

This role is ideal for someone with junior level experience and eager to refine their technical and strategic skills in a fast-paced, results-oriented acquisition marketing environment.

Key Responsibilities

Campaign Build & Execution

  • Build, test, and deploy email campaigns, including audience segmentation, dynamic content, and personalisation
  • Manage end-to-end campaign execution within Salesforce Marketing Cloud marketing automation platform
  • Ensure accurate campaign setup, QA, and timely deployment

Performance Optimisation

  • Collaborate with the marketing and analytics teams to track performance metrics such as open rates, click-through rates, and conversions
  • Conduct A/B testing on subject lines, design, and CTAs to improve campaign effectiveness
  • Implement best practices in design, deliverability, inbox placement, and compliance (GDPR, CAN-SPAM)

Collaboration & Process

  • Work closely with designers, copywriters, and marketing managers to ensure campaign creative aligns with strategic objectives
  • Maintain campaign documentation, ensuring consistency and accuracy in campaign tracking and reporting
  • Support the rollout of automated customer journeys, triggered communications, and performance workflows

To Succeed In The Role You Must Have

  • Minimal experience in email marketing campaign execution
  • Hands-on experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud email marketing platforms
  • Strong attention to detail and understanding of HTML for email and basic design principles
  • Experience with audience segmentation, dynamic content, and data-driven targeting
  • Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret and report on performance data and recommend optimisations
  • Excellent organisational and communication skills

Preferred Skills

  • Exposure to A/B testing and reporting tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Tableau, Looker)
  • Familiarity with CRM systems and marketing automation including SQL
  • Understanding of lifecycle marketing automation
  • Understanding of acquisition marketing funnels and metrics

What Success In This Role Looks Like

  • High-quality, error-free campaign deployment
  • Improved engagement and conversion metrics across campaigns
  • Demonstrated initiative in suggesting and testing new ways to improve performance and strategy
  • Seamless collaboration with cross-functional marketing teams

AI usage for your application

We are an innovative organisation that encourages the use of technology. We recognise that candidates may utilise AI tools to support with their job application process. However, it is essential that all information you provide truthfully and accurately reflects your own experience, skills, and qualifications.

What We Offer

Our benefits package is designed to support your wellbeing, growth, and work-life balance. It includes a highly competitive pension or 401(k) plan, private health insurance, and 24/7 access to counselling and wellbeing resources through our Employee Assistance Program.

We also offer a range of lifestyle benefits, including our Work From Anywhere program, which allows you to work from any location where you have the legal right to do so for up to 25 days per year. In addition, we provide generous annual and parental leave, as well as dedicated days off for volunteering and even for moving home.

You will also be given free access to all The Economist content, including an online subscription, our range of apps, podcasts and more.

json.descriptionHtml:
Central Employment are working with a scaling North East Search and Performance Marketing agency, as they look to expand there dedicated Klayvio team, with the appointment of an Email Marketing Campaign Lead.


2-3 days in Teesside

¬£40,000-¬£47,000 DOE


This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who wants to work on a number of key eCommerce client campaigns, execute Klayvio strategies, while contributing to the success of an ambitious and supportive agency.


Email Marketing Campaign Lead responsibilities:

  • Build and manage flows, campaigns and automations in Klaviyo
  • Work closely with clients to understand objectives and deliver email strategies that drive revenue
  • Run A/B split tests and optimise for performance
  • Segment databases effectively for targeting and personalisation
  • Collaborate with design, UX, SEO and Ads teams to ensure consistent messaging
  • Monitor analytics and prepare reports on campaign performance
  • Stay up to date with email marketing trends, best practices and new features in Klaviyo
  • Motivate, mentor and build out an internal Email Marketing/Klayvio team


Essential experience:

  • Hands-on experience using Klaviyo in an agency or in-house environment, circa 3+ yrs dedicated channel experience
  • Strong understanding of email marketing flows and campaign management
  • Knowledge of Shopify and ecommerce platforms
  • Ability to run and interpret A/B split tests
  • Awareness of SEO, Ads and UX principles (with full support from in-house experts)
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to turn data into actionable insight
  • Excellent communication and organisational skills
  • Creative mindset with attention to detail
json.benefits: This range is provided by Central Employment. Your actual pay will be based on your skills and experience ‚Äî talk with your recruiter to learn more.

json.title: Customer Marketing Coordinator
json.description: COMPANY OVERVIEWAt Burberry, we believe creativity opens spaces. Our purpose is to unlock the power of imagination to push boundaries and open new possibilities for our people, our customers and our communities. This is the core belief that has guided Burberry since it was founded in 1856 and is central to how we operate as a company today. We aim to provide an environment for creative minds from different backgrounds to thrive, bringing a wide range of skills and experiences to everything we do. As a purposeful, values-driven brand, we are committed to being a force for good in the world as well, creating the next generation of sustainable luxury for customers, driving industry change and championing our communities.JOB PURPOSEThe Customer Marketing Coordinator supports the execution and coordination of global and regional customer outreach. This role ensures smooth delivery of campaign briefs, content, and customer communication across email, messaging and .com.Working at the centre of the Customer Marketing function, the coordinator connects Marketing, Digital, CRM, Merchandising and Regional teams, helping to keep plans aligned and ensuring all content and deliverables move through the process efficiently and on time.RESPONSIBILITIESCalendar Coordination & Planning SupportSupport the planning and briefing of 1:Many customer outreach (Email and Messaging) across full price, outlet and regional communications.Maintain clear documentation, trackers and updates so all teams have visibility on plans and progress and ensuring accuracy and alignment with Marketing, Commercial and Regional updates.Coordinate regional needs and consolidate inputs to help shape global campaign briefs and timings.Assist with planning and briefing for .com customer pages, service-led destinations and campaign storytelling content.Track deliverables and deadlines, following up with stakeholders to ensure on-time delivery and clear handovers.Coordinate with the Customer Marketing manager and CRM orchestration team on audience requirements, segmentation inputs and personalisation needs.Content Coordination & Delivery ManagementOrganise and manage content inputs for customer campaigns, json.descriptionHtml:
COMPANY OVERVIEW


At Burberry, we believe creativity opens spaces. Our purpose is to unlock the power of imagination to push boundaries and open new possibilities for our people, our customers and our communities. This is the core belief that has guided Burberry since it was founded in 1856 and is central to how we operate as a company today. We aim to provide an environment for creative minds from different backgrounds to thrive, bringing a wide range of skills and experiences to everything we do. As a purposeful, values-driven brand, we are committed to being a force for good in the world as well, creating the next generation of sustainable luxury for customers, driving industry change and championing our communities.


JOB PURPOSE


The Customer Marketing Coordinator supports the execution and coordination of global and regional customer outreach. This role ensures smooth delivery of campaign briefs, content, and customer communication across email, messaging and .com.


Working at the centre of the Customer Marketing function, the coordinator connects Marketing, Digital, CRM, Merchandising and Regional teams, helping to keep plans aligned and ensuring all content and deliverables move through the process efficiently and on time.


RESPONSIBILITIES


Calendar Coordination & Planning Support

  • Support the planning and briefing of 1:Many customer outreach (Email and Messaging) across full price, outlet and regional communications.
  • Maintain clear documentation, trackers and updates so all teams have visibility on plans and progress and ensuring accuracy and alignment with Marketing, Commercial and Regional updates.
  • Coordinate regional needs and consolidate inputs to help shape global campaign briefs and timings.
  • Assist with planning and briefing for .com customer pages, service-led destinations and campaign storytelling content.
  • Track deliverables and deadlines, following up with stakeholders to ensure on-time delivery and clear handovers.
  • Coordinate with the Customer Marketing manager and CRM orchestration team on audience requirements, segmentation inputs and personalisation needs.


Content Coordination & Delivery Management

  • Organise and manage content inputs for customer campaigns, consolidating requests from Customer Marketing, Regional CE, Retail CRM and Digital teams.
  • Assist in the execution of the customer content process: mapping needs, preparing briefs, tracking production, routing for approvals and supporting delivery to Customer teams.
  • Partner with Creative, Production and Digital Content teams to ensure assets fit channel requirements and support the customer experience.


Execution & Operational Support

  • Support campaign delivery and readiness across email, messaging and .com, working in partnership with CRM, Production teams and Digital teams.
  • Assist with QA processes for campaign assets, links, content accuracy and page readiness, where necessary.


Reporting & Performance Coordination

  • Analysis campaigns and experiences and report on performance for monthly, quarterly and campaign-level reporting.
  • Ensure reports and insight are shared with internal stakeholders and Regions in a clear and consistent way.
  • Work with Customer Insight and D&A teams to ensure data sources and reporting templates are up to date.


PERSONAL PROFILE


  • Good experience in customer marketing, CRM, digital marketing or campaign coordination.
  • Strong organisational skills with the ability to manage multiple stakeholders and timelines.
  • Comfortable working with briefs, content workflows and cross-functional teams.
  • Detail-oriented with good problem-solving and follow-through skills.
  • Strong communicator who can keep teams aligned and up to date.
  • Interest in customer journeys, CRM, content and digital experience and previous experience in luxury/fashion/retail preferable.


Burberry is an Equal Opportunities Employer and as such, treats all applications equally and recruits purely on the basis of skills and experience.

json.title: Search Engine Optimization Manager
json.description: The Profs Group is looking for a technically strong, hands-on SEO Manager to lead our organic growth across three brands: The Profs, Spires, and BitPaper. SEO is a core pillar of our digital strategy, and this role will own the development of a future-proof SEO roadmap in an environment shaped by AI-enabled search.About the RoleYou will lead a team of three SEO contractors while driving technical excellence, organic performance, and scalable processes across our digital ecosystem. If you thrive in technical SEO, love solving crawl issues, and are excited by where AI search is heading, this role is for you.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and deliver a comprehensive SEO strategy roadmap across traditional and emerging AI-powered search platforms.Lead, mentor, and manage an offshore SEO team, creating high-performance ways of working.Act as the technical SEO expert across the business, ensuring alignment with senior stakeholders.Champion SEO internally ‚Äî sharing insights, identifying growth opportunities, and embedding best practice.Partner with brand teams to shape long-term organic growth plans.Conduct deep technical SEO audits and support budget planning and forecasting.Diagnose and resolve issues related to crawlability, indexing, and site architecture.Collaborate with developers and contractors to implement technical improvements.Leverage AI tools to enhance research, content ideation, automation, and performance analysis.Stay ahead of algorithm updates, industry shifts, and AI-driven search changes.Define and track SEO OKRs aligned with our wider commercial goals.Ensure timely delivery of SEO initiatives within budget, with a strong focus on performance KPIs.Qualifications5+ years‚Äô technical SEO experience, ideally with complex or large-scale sites.Strong understanding of web technologies, site architecture, HTML/CSS, and ideally basic coding ability.Ability to work with large datasets using GA4, GSC, and leading SEO platforms.Proven ability to design and execute SEO strategies that deliver measurable results.Strong awareness of LLM-driven search and the evolving search landscape.Experience using AI to support content workflows, research, and reporting.Excellent communication skills, able to translate technical concepts for non-technical audiences.Strong problem-solving skills and a naturally inquisitive mindset.Up-to-date knowledge of SEO trends, Google algorithms, and digital marketing fundamentals.2:1 degree or equivalent.Required SkillsDeep experience in keyword research and intent mapping.Creative and innovative approach to growth and strategy.Experience leading SEO teams and managing contractors.Advanced technical SEO knowledge including crawlability, site structure, and performance optimisation.Proficient in GA4 and SEO platforms such as SE Ranking (or equivalents).Strong stakeholder management skills.Analytical thinker with strong project management capabilities.Passionate learner who stays ahead of SEO and AI search developments.Excellent understanding of search algorithm behaviour.Pay range and compensation package¬£45-55k dependent on experienceOffice Culture & BenefitsOur culture is social, collaborative and centred around continuous growth. We regularly host team events and celebrate key milestones. json.descriptionHtml:
The Profs Group is looking for a technically strong, hands-on SEO Manager to lead our organic growth across three brands: The Profs, Spires, and BitPaper. SEO is a core pillar of our digital strategy, and this role will own the development of a future-proof SEO roadmap in an environment shaped by AI-enabled search.


About the Role

You will lead a team of three SEO contractors while driving technical excellence, organic performance, and scalable processes across our digital ecosystem. If you thrive in technical SEO, love solving crawl issues, and are excited by where AI search is heading, this role is for you.


Responsibilities

  • Develop and deliver a comprehensive SEO strategy roadmap across traditional and emerging AI-powered search platforms.
  • Lead, mentor, and manage an offshore SEO team, creating high-performance ways of working.
  • Act as the technical SEO expert across the business, ensuring alignment with senior stakeholders.
  • Champion SEO internally ‚Äî sharing insights, identifying growth opportunities, and embedding best practice.
  • Partner with brand teams to shape long-term organic growth plans.
  • Conduct deep technical SEO audits and support budget planning and forecasting.
  • Diagnose and resolve issues related to crawlability, indexing, and site architecture.
  • Collaborate with developers and contractors to implement technical improvements.
  • Leverage AI tools to enhance research, content ideation, automation, and performance analysis.
  • Stay ahead of algorithm updates, industry shifts, and AI-driven search changes.
  • Define and track SEO OKRs aligned with our wider commercial goals.
  • Ensure timely delivery of SEO initiatives within budget, with a strong focus on performance KPIs.


Qualifications

  • 5+ years‚Äô technical SEO experience, ideally with complex or large-scale sites.
  • Strong understanding of web technologies, site architecture, HTML/CSS, and ideally basic coding ability.
  • Ability to work with large datasets using GA4, GSC, and leading SEO platforms.
  • Proven ability to design and execute SEO strategies that deliver measurable results.
  • Strong awareness of LLM-driven search and the evolving search landscape.
  • Experience using AI to support content workflows, research, and reporting.
  • Excellent communication skills, able to translate technical concepts for non-technical audiences.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and a naturally inquisitive mindset.
  • Up-to-date knowledge of SEO trends, Google algorithms, and digital marketing fundamentals.
  • 2:1 degree or equivalent.


Required Skills

  • Deep experience in keyword research and intent mapping.
  • Creative and innovative approach to growth and strategy.
  • Experience leading SEO teams and managing contractors.
  • Advanced technical SEO knowledge including crawlability, site structure, and performance optimisation.
  • Proficient in GA4 and SEO platforms such as SE Ranking (or equivalents).
  • Strong stakeholder management skills.
  • Analytical thinker with strong project management capabilities.
  • Passionate learner who stays ahead of SEO and AI search developments.
  • Excellent understanding of search algorithm behaviour.


Pay range and compensation package

¬£45-55k dependent on experience


Office Culture & Benefits

Our culture is social, collaborative and centred around continuous growth. We regularly host team events and celebrate key milestones. Recent socials have included axe throwing, electric shuffleboard, virtual clay pigeon shooting and curling.


Additional benefits include:

‚Ä¢ Free on-site gym

‚Ä¢ 31 days annual leave including Bank Holidays (with opportunities to earn additional days)

‚Ä¢ Company pension plan

‚Ä¢ Regular company socials

‚Ä¢ Two work-from-home days per week

‚Ä¢ Ongoing training and development from experienced sales leaders


The Profs has met or exceeded its targets every year and continues to achieve year-on-year growth.


How to Apply

To apply, please send:

  1. Your CV
  2. A short explanation of why you are interested in The Profs and why this particular role is a strong fit for you.

json.descriptionHtml:
Because you can see how we can be better. Innovate, your way.

The SEO Analyst is responsible for analysing the content of the UK/Ireland and United States websites, identifying gaps, and optimising pages to improve search performance. The role involves uncovering marketing opportunities and providing recommendations to drive website traffic. All recommendations must be clear, actionable, and measurable, with defined success metrics to evaluate their impact. As part of the expanding Digital function, you will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, tenacious, and innovative environment.

What You‚Äôll Get

People are at the heart of what we do at Primark so it‚Äôs essential we provide the right environment for you to perform at your best.

Let‚Äôs talk lifestyle:

  • 27 days of leave, plus bank holidays and if you want, you can buy 5 more.
  • Flexible Working, the opportunity for an early Friday finish, and a subsidised cafeteria.
  • Primark Perks ‚Äì Discounts with some local partner businesses to our offices

What you'll do:

  • Support the SEO Manager in delivering the SEO roadmap by driving execution, meeting timelines, and prioritising tasks effectively.
  • Collaborate with the SEO Manager, digital trading, content teams and other stakeholders to ensure the site is fully optimised, with content that balances SEO performance and wider business goals.
  • Research, analyse, and optimise commercial and editorial content, providing recommendations and rewriting where needed to maximise visibility, engagement, and traffic.
  • Perform keyword research, competitor benchmarking, and in-SERP analysis to identify opportunities and inform strategy
  • Conduct regular site audits, performance analyses, and reporting to uncover issues and opportunities
  • Identify, propose, and deliver new SEO initiatives that support organic channel growth.
  • Monitor SEO activity weekly, generating insights to shape and refine the future roadmap.

What you'll bring:

  • 2-3 years‚Äô B2C SEO Experience, ideally within the digital/retail space
  • Experience with Google Analytics, Google Search Console as well as SEO tools such as Screaming Frog, SISTRIX, Botify, SEMrush, etc.
  • Excellent planning and organisation skills, ability to multi-task, plan and prioritise work schedule for self and work within agreed timescales.

Because you can see how we can be better. Innovate, your way.

What‚Äôs a career at Primark all about? The positive impact you‚Äôre making, the experiences you‚Äôre having and the people you‚Äôre with. You‚Äôre our inspiration. Embrace what sets you apart, own your career and develop in ways you never expected. Leave your mark. And do it your way.

SR Req Number‚ÄØJR 898

Our fashion isn‚Äôt one-size-fits-all and neither is our culture. Primark promotes equal employment opportunity, we strive to create an inclusive workplace where people can be themselves, access opportunities and thrive together.

If you require extra support at any stage of the selection process, please get in touch with our team at removingbarriers@primark.co.uk.

REQ ID: JR-898

You will play a key role in developing strong relationships and shared ethos, whilst at the same time benefit from a wide range of career opportunities, training and flexibility for work-life balance.¬†¬†Our culture is built on curiosity and we are looking for team members who have a passion for learning about the developments in the industry, their clients and their peers. json.descriptionHtml:
About Adapt


Adapt (a Welocalize company), is an international digital performance marketing agency focused on driving the success of digital content across platforms and markets. We offer our customers a unique combination of global services designed to support their growth from strategy all the way through to execution, production and performance measurement. With a remote-first structure, you will join a unique culture which celebrates difference and embraces diversity. You will play a key role in developing strong relationships and shared ethos, whilst at the same time benefit from a wide range of career opportunities, training and flexibility for work-life balance.  


Our culture is built on curiosity and we are looking for team members who have a passion for learning about the developments in the industry, their clients and their peers. In return, we offer the opportunity to develop your ability and exposure to a wide range of clients from growth minded startups all the way up to global enterprise clients. Our client base is predominantly focused on B2B businesses, though we do also support customers in the  e-commerce and retail space. Regardless of vertical, Adapt offers dynamic and diverse challenges that foster creativity, innovation and application of knowledge to create client solutions.


Overview


Adapt is looking for an experienced YouTube SEO Specialist to support our channel growth initiatives. In this freelance role, you‚Äôll help shape and execute our YouTube SEO strategy: optimizing visibility, engagement, and conversion performance through data-driven insights and best practices.


This role will initially require 5-10 hours of work per month the next 12 months with the possibility to collaborate in more projects/clients with time.


Key Responsibilities
  • Conduct keyword and topic research for YouTube to identify high-impact opportunities and inform content strategy
  • Optimize video metadata (titles, descriptions, tags, thumbnails, filenames, and playlists) to maximize visibility and click-through rate
  • Analyze channel and video performance using YouTube Analytics and other SEO tools to identify trends, opportunities, and actionable insights
  • Perform competitor and trend research within the client‚Äôs niche to uncover content and optimization gaps
  • Optimize video distribution and promotion strategy, including playlists, linking, and cross-platform promotion
  • Collaborate closely with Paid Media, Analytics, and Content teams to align YouTube SEO efforts with broader marketing goals and campaigns
  • Stay up to date with YouTube algorithm changes, SEO best practices, and emerging trends to continuously improve channel performance


Skills & Qualifications
  • Proven experience optimizing YouTube channels or videos with measurable performance growth
  • Strong understanding of what makes a good video: including factors that drive retention and engagement (hook, pacing, storytelling, end-screens, cards, etc.)
  • Proficiency with YouTube Studio, TubeBuddy, VidIQ, Google Trends, and related keyword research or analytics tools
  • Data-driven mindset with the ability to interpret analytics and translate insights into actionable strategies
  • Strong collaboration skills and able to work cross-functionally with Paid Media, Content, and SEO teams to ensure cohesive campaign execution
  • Excellent communication and reporting abilities, comfortable presenting findings and recommendations



We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

json.title: Search Engine Optimization Specialist

json.descriptionHtml:
SEO Specialist


Job Type 12-month contract

Salary: DOE

Location: London & WFH

Consultant: Mags Rendle


The Company

The Digital Recruitment Company are partners to an international, non-profit organization dedicated to providing financial education and professional development for investment specialists.


They are working to build an investment industry where investors‚Äô interests come first, financial markets function at their best, and economies grow. They are driven by the belief that lasting economic growth depends on trust, competence, and transparency in financial markets, and we know that it must be led by professionals adhering to the highest levels of ethics and investment expertise


The Role

The SEO Specialist/Manager is responsible for implementing and optimizing organic search strategy, developed in collaboration with the SEO Lead. This hands-on role has two core dimensions: (1) executing technical and on-page SEO updates, and (2) drafting and commissioning content aligned with SEO objectives.


The role works closely with content, digital, and product marketing teams, as well as agency partners, to ensure SEO updates and content deliverables are executed efficiently and support visibility improvements across the company and the Research & Policy Center (RPC) web properties.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Implement on-page SEO best practices including metadata, internal linking, keyword optimization and structural content updates
  • Support technical SEO delivery and optimization across high-priority pages, ensuring crawlability, indexation, and site health
  • Assist in implementing schema markup, structured content and formatting to strengthen Generative Engine Optimization (GEO) and AI search visibility
  • Draft and commission content by preparing briefs, engaging AI tools and specialist writers, and managing SME approvals to ensure accuracy, optimization, and brand alignment
  • Partner with agency resources to deliver SEO activities in line with internal priorities
  • Track search visibility, keyword performance, AI mentions and audience behavior using Search Console, Semrush, Adobe Analytics and internal dashboards; produce reporting, audits, and insights to guide ongoing optimization.


Required Skills:

  • 4‚Äì7 years of experience in an SEO-focused role, with proven ability to execute both technical and content-driven optimization
  • Strong knowledge of SEO fundamentals including on-page, technical, schema markup, and structured content optimization; international SEO experience is a plus
  • Experience creating or commissioning content in line with SEO strategy, including briefing writers and managing SME approvals
  • Proficiency with SEO tools such as Google Search Console, Semrush, Screaming Frog, heatmaps, and Adobe Analytics (or Google Analytics)
  • Experience managing or coordinating agency resources to support SEO delivery
  • Hands-on experience updating content within a CMS, with strong attention to detail and quality standards
  • Skilled in coordinating SEO workflows, including tasks, timelines, and stakeholders to ensure timely, high-quality delivery
  • Awareness of evolving SEO trends, including Generative Engine Optimization (GEO), AI-powered search environments, and zero-click SERPs
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to operate in a cross-functional, global environment.


Why apply

Whatever your long-term career ambition, you will be joining a company who will provide you with the flexibility for you to develop your career.They offer a supportive and welcoming working environment, including hybrid working. They will take your career seriously to enable you to be the best you can be.


The Digital Recruitment Company is an Employment Business for interim, contract and temporary recruitment and acts as an Employment Agency in relation to permanent vacancies.

To apply for this role please contact us at:

Mags Rendle

0203 640 2133

mags@digitalrecruitmentcompany.com

www.digitalrecruitmentcompany.com

json.descriptionHtml:
Central Employment are working with an established Digital Creative Agency, as they look to appoint a Senior SEO Strategist.


x 4 days in office, Wednesday WFH

Circa ¬£40k-¬£45k DOE


Senior SEO Strategist:

The ideal candidate should have a strong understanding of the search engine landscape, with the ability to develop and implement effective campaigns & client strategies, as well as drive link-building initiatives to improve organic search rankings.


Responsibilities:

  • Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs, and delivering tailored SEO strategies to achieve their goals and drive results
  • Plan, execute and monitor SEO campaigns across various search engines and platforms
  • Conduct keyword research and analysis to identify relevant search terms and opportunities for optimisation
  • Optimise ad copy and landing pages for maximum click-through and conversion rates
  • Perform link audits and analysis to identify and resolve potential issues with client link profiles
  • Conduct regular audits of our website to identify technical issues that may affect search engine rankings
  • Develop and implement strategies for optimising website structure, page speed, and other technical aspects of SEO
  • Work with developers to ensure that website code is optimised for search engines and that best practices are followed
  • Monitor website performance metrics and use data to make data-driven decisions
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in technical SEO and search engine algorithms
  • Collaborate, mentor and support other members of the marketing team to integrate multi-disciplinary initiatives with other marketing channels (e.g. social media, PR & content marketing, etc.)


Senior SEO Strategist experience:

  • 3-5 years‚Äô experience ideally within an SEO / Performance Marketing agency environment
  • Experience in SEM and SEO
  • Experience in a client facing role
  • Strategically focused
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Experience with SEO tools such as Screaming Frog, Moz, SEMrush, and Google Analytics
  • Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and other web development technologies is a plus
json.benefits: This range is provided by Central Employment. Your actual pay will be based on your skills and experience ‚Äî talk with your recruiter to learn more.

Some perks of joining Henkel Flexible work scheme with flexible hours, hybrid work model, and work from anywhere policy for up to 30 days per yearDiverse national and international growth opportunitiesGlobal wellbeing standards with health and preventive care programsGender-neutral parental leave for a minimum of 8 weeksEmployee Share Plan with voluntary investment and Henkel matching sharesPerformance bonus / incentivesCompetitive Pension & Life Assurance - Company contributes up to 10% of basic salaryAnnual Leave: 27 days plus 8 Bank HolidaysCelebration vouchersAt Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. json.descriptionHtml:
About This Position

Join us as a Digital Marketing Graduate and get the opportunity to work alongside professionals from diverse backgrounds to achieve common goals and drive organisational success. This is how you can dare to make an impact:

What You¬¥ll Do

  • Join Henkel‚Äôs Consumer Brands team as a Digital Marketing Graduate and work with iconic brands such as Pritt, Sellotape, Loctite, UniBond Sealants, and UniBond No more Nails.
  • Develop a deep understanding of the market through analysis of market data and competitor activity.
  • Work with the brand and eCommerce/shopper team to create local digital assets across brands.
  • Review content on websites and social media platforms, to develop strategies for better performance of assets.
  • Working with the wider team to develop and execute ideas for websites and social media platforms (Meta, TikTok and YouTube)
  • Regularly track, review, and optimise performance of social content and provide actionable insights to help shape the social strategy.
  • Track and analyse competitor digital activities.
  • Ensure the brands are at the forefront of digital opportunities (social media, e-commerce, brand websites).
  • Identify emerging digital trends that can lead to commercial opportunities.
  • This one-year programme is designed to develop knowledge, skills and expertise across a wide range of Marketing skills ‚Äì brand & portfolio management; digital marketing, social media & community management; stakeholder management; commercial awareness.

What makes you a good fit

  • You should graduate (before September 2026 and no more than two years prior) with a Bachelor, Masters (or equivalent) degree in Business, Marketing, or any related field.
  • Previous experience in a multinational FMCG company is an advantage.
  • Positivity and a high energy level.
  • An enthusiastic team player who is digitally driven.
  • Passion for the adhesives for consumer and craftsman industry; and for DIY and stationery brands.
  • Willingness to challenge the status quo.
  • Good judgement and creative thinking with a positive sense of initiative.
  • Strong analytical skills.
  • Good attention to detail.
  • Computer literate and confident with the MS Office suite and other computer systems.

Some perks of joining Henkel

  • Flexible work scheme with flexible hours, hybrid work model, and work from anywhere policy for up to 30 days per year
  • Diverse national and international growth opportunities
  • Global wellbeing standards with health and preventive care programs
  • Gender-neutral parental leave for a minimum of 8 weeks
  • Employee Share Plan with voluntary investment and Henkel matching shares
  • Performance bonus / incentives
  • Competitive Pension & Life Assurance - Company contributes up to 10% of basic salary
  • Annual Leave: 27 days plus 8 Bank Holidays
  • Celebration vouchers

At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, disabilities, and generations.

json.descriptionHtml:
About the Company

The Profs Group is an award-winning EdTech organisation delivering world-class tutoring and admissions support through innovative marketplace and agency models. We serve thousands of students and tutors globally and are recognised in Forbes 30 Under 30, Education Investor, and the UK's Top 100 Startups.


About the Role

We are searching for a data-driven, commercially minded PPC Executive/Specialist to take ownership of paid search performance across our three brands. As an award-winning EdTech group operating marketplace and tuition agency platforms, we work within complex funnels where subject-level performance, tutor supply/demand, and academic seasonality all matter. You‚Äôll play a key role in scaling one of our most commercially critical channels, working closely with our PPC Manager and wider marketing team across UK and international markets.


Responsibilities

  • Own end-to-end PPC campaign management across Google Ads (and ideally Microsoft Ads).
  • Build, optimise and scale campaigns across search, PMax, AI bidding and new ad formats.
  • Audit and rebuild account structures to drive efficiency and performance.
  • Manage campaigns in line with marketplace dynamics: tutor availability, subject-level demand, and seasonality.
  • Optimise bids, budgets, and ad copy to hit growth KPIs and ROI targets.
  • Conduct deep keyword research, competitive analysis, and intent mapping.
  • Build and maintain robust negative keyword frameworks and granular campaign segmentation.
  • Analyse the full multi-step funnel (lead ‚Üí job post ‚Üí booking ‚Üí tuition sessions) and optimise accordingly.
  • Forecast demand around academic cycles and strategically front-load budgets.
  • Create and manage remarketing audiences across funnel stages.
  • Run structured A/B tests across ads and landing pages.
  • Deliver weekly performance insights by subject, level, region and funnel stage.
  • Collaborate with Marketing, Product, and Tutor Operations to align PPC strategy with business priorities.
  • Build and maintain dashboards (ideally Looker Studio) to visualise and communicate performance.
  • Stay ahead of platform updates, automation trends, AI tools, and emerging paid search tactics.


Required Skills

  • 3+ years‚Äô hands-on PPC experience (in-house or agency).
  • Proven results on large, complex search accounts (ideally ¬£25k+ monthly).
  • Strong analytical skills and the ability to translate data into clear actions.
  • Deep understanding of search intent, landing page alignment, and multi-step funnels.
  • Experience managing seasonal or demand-driven campaigns.
  • Confident communicator with the ability to work cross-functionally.
  • Comfortable in fast-moving environments with imperfect data.
  • A curious, experimental mindset ‚Äî always testing, learning and optimising.
  • Experience with Looker Studio dashboards is a major plus.
  • Degree (2:1 or equivalent).


Preferred Skills

  • Microsoft Ads experience.
  • Meta Ads or multi-channel performance knowledge.
  • Affiliate or programmatic experience.
  • Advanced Excel skills; SQL is a bonus.
  • Experience in education, marketplaces, or lead-gen environments.


Pay range and compensation package

  • ¬£30-40k PA


KPIs / Performance Metrics

  • CPA by subject, level, and region.
  • Lead‚Üíjob-post and job-post‚Üípayment conversion rates.
  • ROAS and contribution margin.
  • Budget pacing accuracy.
  • Performance vs academic/seasonal forecasts.


Office Culture & Benefits

Our culture is social, collaborative and centred around continuous growth. We regularly host team events and celebrate key milestones. Recent socials have included axe throwing, electric shuffleboard, virtual clay pigeon shooting and curling.


Additional benefits include:

‚Ä¢ Free on-site gym

‚Ä¢ 31 days annual leave including Bank Holidays (with opportunities to earn additional days)

‚Ä¢ Company pension plan

‚Ä¢ Regular company socials

‚Ä¢ Two work-from-home days per week

‚Ä¢ Ongoing training and development from experienced sales leaders


The Profs has met or exceeded its targets every year and continues to achieve year-on-year growth.


How to Apply

To apply, please send:

  1. Your CV
  2. A short explanation of why you are interested in The Profs and why this particular role is a strong fit for you.
json.benefits: This range is provided by The Profs. Your actual pay will be based on your skills and experience ‚Äî talk with your recruiter to learn more.
