json.descriptionHtml:
PPC Manager ‚Äì Fully Remote (but must be UK based and have full right to work) | ¬£40,000‚Äì¬£50,000


A rare chance to own performance marketing in a profitable, fast-growing, fully remote travel-tech company.


This is one of the few true 100% remote performance marketing roles currently available ‚Äî offering real ownership, high budgets, international scope, and the opportunity to work directly with senior decision-makers in a business that moves fast, tests fast, and scales fast.


‚≠ê The Company

A well-established, profitable travel-tech business operating globally. The company has experienced strong, consistent year-on-year growth and serves millions of users annually. It‚Äôs an agile, mission-driven organisation with a fully remote team across multiple countries.

That‚Äôs all you need to know ‚Äî the real value of this opportunity is the role itself.


‚≠ê The Role: PPC Manager

Reporting to the Performance Marketing Lead, you‚Äôll take on a central role in building and scaling paid search and paid social activity as the business continues its rapid expansion. This is only the second in-house performance role, as the company transitions away from agency-led management ‚Äî meaning you‚Äôll have significant influence, freedom, and ownership.


What you'll be doing

  • Owning and optimising large-scale paid search campaigns.
  • Developing strategies to drive revenue growth, ROI improvements, and international expansion.
  • Working with a substantial annual budget of ¬£2.5M+ (with scope to scale further).
  • Automating, systemising, and improving processes to unlock greater efficiency.
  • Partnering closely with senior leadership ‚Äî including the MD, Founder, SEO Lead, and Data Scientist ‚Äî to shape performance strategy.
  • Operating in a fast-test, fast-implement culture where good ideas get shipped quickly.


‚≠ê What They‚Äôre Looking For

  • A commercially minded, data-driven PPC specialist with approx 3‚Äì5+ years managing high-value, high-volume paid search activity.
  • Experience running ¬£5M+ annual spend across global paid search
  • Strong analytical skills and an understanding of attribution and e-commerce performance drivers.
  • SA360 experience is essential, ideally with template or inventory management exposure.
  • Bonus: hands-on experience in Meta, TikTok, or other paid social environments.
  • Above all: someone who loves experimenting, optimising, learning, and getting things done.


‚≠ê Why This Role Is Special

This is not a typical PPC job. Here‚Äôs why candidates get excited:

  • True 100% fully remote ‚Äî work from anywhere, including abroad.
  • Minimal red tape ‚Äî ideas can move from concept to launch in days, not months.
  • ‚ÄúEffectively unlimited‚Äù budget as long as ROAS is met.
  • Huge scope for experimentation across platforms (Meta, TikTok, Reddit, Quora, etc.).
  • International growth ‚Äî the company is expanding significantly across Europe and beyond, offering exposure to new markets and scaling opportunities.
  • Strategic influence ‚Äî this isn‚Äôt just activation; you‚Äôll shape how the performance function evolves.
  • Rapid scaling environment ‚Äî campaigns routinely scale from tens of thousands to hundreds of thousands in-season.
  • Profitable, growing business with plans to expand the team and build additional accounts.
  • Purpose-driven mission supporting rural communities and positive industry change.
  • Clear progression opportunities as the performance team grows in the coming year.


üí∞ Salary & Location

  • ¬£40,000‚Äì¬£50,000
  • 100% Remote

json.descriptionHtml:
Our client is an expanding SME business with offices across the globe. They have a newly created role in their Oxford office for a permanent Digital Marketing Assistant.


Reporting into the Marketing Director, typical duties will be to:


  • Develop and execute the company social media strategy across platforms.
  • Create, shoot, and edit engaging multimedia content tailored to each platform.

Candidates that apply must have hands-on experience of creating and developing social media content. A creative mindset is key, with a strong understanding of social platforms and their audiences, SEO and website upkeep. Strong communication skills are key as there will be some customer interaction at trade shows. A degree in marketing or related field is key as well as some practical experience.


On offer is a base salary of 30-40k (depending on experience), with good benefits such as 30 days holiday, the opportunity to travel (if interested), hybrid working and free onsite parking.

json.descriptionHtml:
SEO Technical Specialist


Job Description:

Our client, a fast-growing digital marketing agency, is seeking an experienced Senior SEO Specialist to lead SEO strategy and execution across a varied client portfolio. This is an exciting permanent opportunity based in Newcastle with flexible working options.


Job Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute comprehensive SEO strategies covering on-page and off-page optimisation for a broad range of clients.
  • Conduct regular SEO audits, track performance against KPIs, and deliver clear monthly insights to internal stakeholders.
  • Provide SEO-focused audits and strategy proposals to support business development efforts.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, to ensure technical implementation of SEO recommendations.
  • Contribute to continuous process improvements and support SEO best practices across the agency.
  • Mentor junior team members and offer strategic input to support the wider digital team.
  • Stay updated on SEO trends, algorithm changes, and the evolving role of AI in search marketing.
  • Take ownership of keyword research, metadata optimisation, content planning, internal linking, and backlink strategies.
  • Utilise SEO tools to produce performance reports and support data-driven decisions.
  • Assist in the implementation of tracking and reporting using tools such as Google Tag Manager and Data Studio.


Experience Required

  • Minimum of 4 years‚Äô experience managing and executing SEO campaigns across diverse industries.
  • Proven track record in technical SEO, including structured data, crawl management, and optimisation techniques.
  • Experience in both local SEO and broader national/international SEO strategies.
  • High level of proficiency in industry-standard tools such as SEMrush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, Google Analytics, and Google Search Console.


Desirable Skills

  • Understanding of AI tools and how they enhance SEO strategy and analysis.
  • Strong analytical and reporting capabilities using Excel and Google Data Studio.
  • Experience in paid search (PPC) is a plus.
  • Background in content creation or direction is advantageous.
  • Familiarity with DevOps collaboration for implementing SEO strategies.


Educational Requirements

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent in Marketing, IT, Communications, or a related field.


Working Hours & Benefits

  • Monday to Friday, full-time hours with flexibility.
  • Fully remote working .
  • Career progression opportunities in a growing agency.
  • Bonus and performance incentives may be included.


HOW TO APPLY:

If you are interested in this role, please apply with your updated CV

json.descriptionHtml:
Our Team

The CRM team is a great team of exceptionally talented marketers. We are responsible for the hundreds of millions of automated post-conversion communications with our customers via multiple mediums with the aim of maximising MVF‚Äôs value we extract per conversion, aiding qualification and maximising both customer and client satisfaction by keeping them informed of the process they are going through with MVF.

The Role

As a CRM Executive, you will be accountable for the performance of your allocated markets and campaigns/subcategories in the CRM team, and you will be responsible for a significant contribution towards the whole of your sector‚Äôs GP. You should also be contributing to the success of the sector in this regard. This includes financial performance (short term and lifetime) vs targets, whilst ensuring you are working effectively with your relevant hubs to ensure you are maximising CRM opportunities, which support MVF‚Äôs winning ways. You should also be aligning yourself with and contributing towards CRM‚Äôs technology and delivery processes.

As a Senior CRM Executive, you will also be performing at the required competency to be trusted with the responsibility of owning, delivering upon and seeing commercial success of team wide projects as defined within the CRM roadmap.

Market and project strategies for commercial success should be well thought through, iterated upon, delivered and communicated by you to align with CRM strategies. You should also exhibit behaviours and skills that are continuously improved against MVF values. Collaboration across the team and with stakeholders should be effective, and you should help the whole team to improve against its goals.

Responsibilities:

  • You will continuously improve team and individual processes to manage campaigns to maximise efficiency and client success.
  • Analyse, own, and improve the segmentation and user experience of your and others' market and subscribers, with improvements delivered successfully to the team.
  • Actively surface high-level performance improvement recommendations, opportunities, and issues across all markets based on data insights and address them with solutions.
  • Identify new campaign/subcategory opportunities with marketing ops and sales and deliver upon them in CRM.
  • Influence, report on, analyse, and suggest tactics to improve deliverability performance and inbox placement across the team.
  • Influence cross-sector/hub CRM testing initiatives, ideas, and rollouts, and you lead, analyse, decide upon, and clearly communicate testing strategies and priorities across the team.
  • Continuously improve reporting so that the team can make better decisions and opportunities/issues are better surfaced, particularly in healthchecks.
  • Communicate, maintain, and improve CRM content quality standards team-wide with successful testing initiatives supplementing these, while content is created, shared, and structured by you to deliver sustained commercial success.
  • Fully understand, successfully influence, direct, and communicate roadmap strategies, commercial strategies, and products business-wide - in particular to Executives.
  • Challenge the team on how initiatives are prioritised and contribute to ensure daily outcomes have the biggest impact.
  • Collaborate successfully within your team and sector/hub, as well as cross-sector, cross-team, and externally to deliver the best outcomes.
  • You will spot and deliver upon opportunities to the team in an effective manner, especially using data to explore and spot these commercial opportunities.
  • You'll set the standard for all executives and are seen as an authority in the team through excellent communication, knowledge & learning sharing.

What Success Looks Like:

  • Market financial performance exceeds plan and target
  • Market contribution (CRM GP:MVF GP) is increasing
  • Project performance exceeds goals
  • Sector financial performance exceeding plan and target is contributed towards significantly
  • Successful interaction with their CRM sector to become an engaged, motivated, world class performer, whilst also developing CRM executives to a similar level
